final_poem:
In memory's shadowed hall,  
A tale unfolds like an old play;   
The story of a lost cause,  
Is written in its echoes repeating. 

Memory buries itself deep within us,  
Where all the past lives reside; 
It keeps watch over our days gone by,  
And whispers of laughter or sighs unseen. 

The tale we tell to ourselves today,  
Is a remnant from yesterday's dream; 
Memory remembers us as though there were no-one else here,  
Yet in every word it finds its echoes unfading.
